Big Oil is recalibrating for the next decade. Q4 results show a clear strategic pivot:

- Strengthening upstream portfolios to avoid production decline
- Cutting costs and trimming investment amid weaker prices
- Scaling back buybacks as balance sheets take priority
- Eyeing AI, data centres and selective low-carbon plays

What do the latest results reveal about the Majorsâ€™ outlook on commodities, US gas, M&A and consolidation?

Find out in the latest Edge: https://t.co/16EpNXxR3j

AIâ€™s power surge is colliding with a real-world bottleneck: gas turbine supply.

New manufacturing capacity is coming, but long lead times mean gas-fired generation may struggle to keep pace with rising US electricity demand this decade, leaving renewables, storage and even coal to help fill the gap.

Read the latest in Energy Pulse: https://t.co/4MKvby7SuP

In reflections from India Energy Week 2026, Simon Flowers explores Indiaâ€™s $7 trillion energy investment challenge, the rise of renewables and hydrogen and why coal and imports will still play a major role in powering the worldâ€™s fastest-growing major economy.

It's Day 2 at #eworld26!

And it's been another busy day here in Essen!  We asked @Christian Becksmith to share with us his insights on #Eworld26 - you can watch his short video below on why this event has been a success so far.  More than fifteen long- and short-term power experts are on hand, meeting with attendees, sharing insights, and demonstrating solutions to support your business through the energy transition.

It's not too late - book a meeting with us today (Wednesday 11th), or Thursday (12th). Alternatively, you can find us at stand 2A126 in Hall 2.
